alert.note: Alert for Beaver; Texas (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 18 at 10:58PM CDT until May 19 at 12:30AM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: The National Weather Service in Amarillo has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Beaver County in the Panhandle of Oklahoma... Southeastern Texas County in the Panhandle of Oklahoma... Lipscomb County in the Panhandle of Texas... Northeastern Hutchinson County in the Panhandle of Texas... Hansford County in the Panhandle of Texas... Northern Roberts County in the Panhandle of Texas... Northern Hemphill County in the Panhandle of Texas... Ochiltree County in the Panhandle of Texas... * Until 1230 AM CDT. * At 1057 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 6 miles north of Sitka to 4 miles east of Perryton, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to roofs, siding, and trees is possible. * Locations impacted include... Perryton, Spearman, Lipscomb, Canadian, Beaver, Booker, Gruver, Forgan, Follett, Higgins, Darrouzett, Hardesty, Gate, Knowles, Wolf Creek Park, Lake Marvin, Slapout, Balko, Elmwood and Farnsworth. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Large hail and damaging winds and continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
